channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Damaged Bollard, Buckingham Gate, 16th June
item.description:
Knocked down unlit reflective bollard on the zebra crossing splitter here. Located on Buckingham Gate, close to the junction with Petty France.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 70, Buckingham Gate, Victoria, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large pile of dog faeces near tree outside 31 Benthal Rd. Also small deposit near gate to no. 31., 16th June
item.description:
Dog mess along the side of this street which has trees is a permanent problem. Camera needed!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Benthal Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Behind Perrin house, inside kilburn park open space., 15th June
item.description:
As youcan see, the illegal homeless encampment is reinforced with a number of lime bikes. These must be collected and the encampment destroyed and removed. The thugs who ruined the park are stalking kids all day. Take action

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal homeless encampment, behind perrin house. Inside Kilburn Park Open Space, DANGER TO CHILDREN, 15th June
item.description:
Once again, this council has failed to permanently get rid of the illegal homeless encampment, which has now moved their trash and built a new camp deeper into Kilburn Park. This time, they are hiding behind trees and have a view of Kilburn Park Primary School and are WATCHING CHILDREN. What will you do when a child gets caught with these aggressive, intoxicated thugs who visibly take drugs and consistently litter our park with the trash they collect? When will you take action and get rid of these people and their rubbish? We have reported this issue to the police, and we will be pushing for an inquiry into Brent Council and those responsible for handling these complaints, as they have truly abandoned the community. We pay so much money to this council so we expect a clean, safe park, not a homeless encampment with dangerous people who harass women and stalk children. If someone gets caught littering, you fine them thousands, but you look the other way when these thugs collect trash and live illegally in the park. You have 5 days to get rid of them, or else MP Georgia Gould will hear from us next.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Malvern Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Electricity box in Chilham Way at junction with Farleigh Avenue, 15th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chilham Way, Hayes, London

item.title: Regular dog fouling, 15th June
item.description:
One dog owner is bringing his dog to Embassy court Da144ew every day and leaving the dog poop on private property. Its either on pathway to our flats or front garden or infront of garage. Many kids live in embassy court and are accidentally stepping on it regularly. The dog owner is not ready to pick up the poop and lets dog poop in our complex. This is getting very unhygenic and dangerous for residents. Dog owner walks in the area in the evening around 7 pm or early morning around 5-6 am
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Embassy Court, Albany Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Norwood Road SE27 very south end from Robson Roa, 15th June
item.description:
Norwood Road SE27 very south end from Robson Road junction to very north end of Knights Hill to Bloom Grove junction north bound carriageway (opposite West Norwood Cemetery main entrance frontage) road markings need re-painting – currently ‘ghost’ markings. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for picture and Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/place/10+Park+Hall+Rd,+Norwood,+London+SE21+8DW/@51.4333431,-0.1037239,3a,64y,37.13h,74.71t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sB6SyWedDUziZEA4S7KNwCQ!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D15.28621876621618%26panoid%3DB6SyWedDUziZEA4S7KNwCQ%26yaw%3D37.132326969708345!7i16384!8i8192!4m6!3m5!1s0x48760400be7aca43:0x6e675e98886f1ec0!8m2!3d51.4350144!4d-0.0948247!16s%2Fg%2F11bw3gz4w3?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MDYxMS4wIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 386, Norwood Road, West Norwood, London

item.title: Vegetation overhanging pavement from street trees, 15th June
item.description:
Hawthorn Vegetation reducing the width of the pavement at the junction between Perry Street and Old Perry Street. Forcing pedestrians to walk close to the edge. Old Perry Street is very busy at this point with cars dropping pupils for Farringtons School.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Perry Street, Chislehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
